   20: 
   21: -module(bs_construct_r24_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25: 	 test1/1, test2/1, test3/1, test4/1, test5/1, testf/1,
   26: 	 not_used/1, in_guard/1,
   27: 	 mem_leak/1, coerce_to_float/1, bjorn/1, append_empty_is_same/1,
   28: 	 huge_float_field/1, system_limit/1, badarg/1,
   29: 	 copy_writable_binary/1, kostis/1, dynamic/1, bs_add/1,
   30: 	 otp_7422/1, zero_width/1, bad_append/1, bs_append_overflow/1,
   31:          bs_append_offheap/1,
   32:          reductions/1, fp16/1, zero_init/1, error_info/1, little/1,
   33:          heap_binary_unit/1,
   34:          otp_24_code_gh_8238/1,
   35:          many_segments/1]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   38: 
   39: suite() ->
   40:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   41:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   42: 
   43: all() -> 
   44:     [test1, test2, test3, test4, test5, testf, not_used,
   45:      in_guard, mem_leak, coerce_to_float, bjorn, append_empty_is_same,
   46:      huge_float_field, system_limit, badarg,
   47:      copy_writable_binary, kostis, dynamic, bs_add, otp_7422, zero_width,
   48:      bad_append, bs_append_overflow, bs_append_offheap,
   49:      reductions, fp16, zero_init,
   50:      error_info, little, heap_binary_unit,
   51:      otp_24_code_gh_8238,
   52:      many_segments].
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   58:     application:stop(os_mon).
   59: 
   60: -define(T(B, L), {B, ??B, L}).
   61: -define(N(B), {B, ??B, unknown}).
   62: 
   63: -define(FAIL(Expr), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, [])).
   64: 
   65: -define(FAIL_VARS(Expr, Vars), fail_check(catch Expr, ??Expr, Vars)).
   66: 
   67: l(I_13, I_big1) ->
   68:     [
   69:      ?T(<<-43>>,
   70: 	[256-43]),
   71:      ?T(<<56>>,
   72: 	[56]),
   73:      ?T(<<1,2>>,
   74: 	[1, 2]),
   75:      ?T(<<4:4, 7:4>>,
   76: 	[4*16+7]),
   77:      ?T(<<777:16/big>>,
   78: 	[3, 9]),
   79:      ?T(<<777:16/little>>,
   80: 	[9, 3]),
   81:      ?T(<<0.0:32/float>>,
   82: 	[0,0,0,0]),
   83:      ?T(<<0.125:32/float>>,
   84: 	[62,0,0,0]),
   85:      ?T(<<0.125:32/little-float>>,
   86: 	[0,0,0,62]),
   87:      ?T(<<I_big1:32>>,
   88: 	[138, 99, 0, 147]),
   89:      ?T(<<57285702734876389752897684:32>>,
   90: 	[138, 99, 0, 148]),
   91:      ?T(<<I_big1:32/little>>,
   92: 	lists:reverse([138, 99, 0, 147])),
   93:      ?T(<<-1:17/unit:8>>,
   94: 	lists:duplicate(17, 255)),
   95: 
   96:      ?T(<<I_13>>,
   97: 	[13]),
   98: 
   99:      ?T(<<4:8/unit:2,5:2/unit:8>>,
  100: 	[0, 4, 0, 5]),
  101: 
  102:      ?T(<<1:1, 0:6, 1:1>>,
  103: 	[129]),
  104:      ?T(<<1:1/little, 0:6/little, 1:1/little>>,
  105: 	[129]),
  106: 
  107:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>/binary>>,
  108: 	[1, 2]),
  109:      ?T(<<<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  110: 	[1]),
  111:      ?T(<<4,3,<<1,2>>:1/binary>>,
  112: 	[4,3,1]),
  113: 
  114:      ?T(<< <<153,27:5>>:I_13/bits, 1:3 >>,
  115:         [153,217]),
  116: 
  117:      ?T(<<(256*45+47)>>,
  118: 	[47]),
  119: 
  120:      ?T(<<57:0>>,
  121: 	[]),
  122: 
  123:      ?T(<<"apa">>,
  124: 	"apa"),
  125: 
  126:      ?T(<<1:3,"string",9:5>>,
  127: 	[46,110,142,77,45,204,233]),
  128: 
  129:      ?T(<<>>,
  130: 	[]),
  131: 
  132:      ?T(<<37.98:64/native-float>>,
  133: 	native_3798()),
  134: 
  135:      ?T(<<32978297842987249827298387697777669766334937:128/native-integer>>,
  136: 	native_bignum()),
  137: 
  138:      ?T(<<$э/native-utf16,$т/native-utf16,$о/native-utf16," спутник"/native-utf16>>,
  139:         native_utf16()),
  140: 
  141:      ?T(<<$в/native-utf32,"ода"/native-utf32>>,
  142: 	native_utf32()),
  143: 
  144:      %% Unit tests.
  145:      ?T(<<<<5:3>>/bitstring>>, <<5:3>>),
  146:      ?T(<<42,<<7:4>>/binary-unit:4>>, <<42,7:4>>),
  147:      ?T(<<<<344:17>>/binary-unit:17>>, <<344:17>>),
  148:      ?T(<<<<42,3,7656:16>>/binary-unit:16>>, <<42,3,7656:16>>),
  149: 
  150:      %% Different sizes and types. First without types.
  151:      ?T(<<I_big1:8>>, [147]),
  152:      ?T(<<I_big1:16>>, [0, 147]),
  153:      ?T(<<I_big1:24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  154:      ?T(<<I_big1:32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  155:      ?T(<<I_big1:40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  156:      ?T(<<I_big1:48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  157:      ?T(<<I_big1:56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  158:      ?T(<<I_big1:64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  159: 
  160:      %% Known integer with range.
  161:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):8>>, [147]),
  162:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):16>>, [0, 147]),
  163:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  164:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  165:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  166:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  167:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 56) - 1)):56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  168:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 64) - 1)):64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  169: 
  170:      %% Known integer with exact range.
  171:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl  8) - 1)):8>>, [147]),
  172:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 16) - 1)):16>>, [0, 147]),
  173:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 24) - 1)):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  174:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 32) - 1)):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  175:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 40) - 1)):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  176:      ?T(<<(I_big1 band ((1 bsl 48) - 1)):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  177: 
  178:      %% Known integer without range.
  179:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):8>>, [147]),
  180:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):16>>, [0, 147]),
  181:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):24>>, [99, 0, 147]),
  182:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):32>>, [138, 99, 0, 147]),
  183:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):40>>, [5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  184:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):48>>, [229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  185:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):56>>, [249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  186:      ?T(<<(I_big1 + 0):64>>, [42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  187: 
  188:      %% Known integer. Verify that the value does not bleed into the
  189:      %% previous segment.
  190:      ?T(<<1, (I_big1 + 0):8>>,  [1, 147]),
  191:      ?T(<<2, (I_big1 + 0):16>>, [2, 0, 147]),
  192:      ?T(<<3, (I_big1 + 0):24>>, [3, 99, 0, 147]),
  193:      ?T(<<4, (I_big1 + 0):32>>, [4, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  194:      ?T(<<5, (I_big1 + 0):40>>, [5, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  195:      ?T(<<6, (I_big1 + 0):48>>, [6, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  196:      ?T(<<7, (I_big1 + 0):56>>, [7, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  197:      ?T(<<8, (I_big1 + 0):64>>, [8, 42, 249, 229, 5, 138, 99, 0, 147]),
  198: 
  199:      %% Test non-byte sizes.
  200:      ?T(<<I_big1:33>>, <<197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  201:      ?T(<<I_big1:39>>, <<11,20,198,1,19:7>>),
  202: 
  203:      ?T(<<I_big1:57>>, <<124,242,130,197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  204:      ?T(<<I_big1:58>>, <<190,121,65,98,152,192,36,3:2>>),
  205:      ?T(<<I_big1:59>>, <<95,60,160,177,76,96,18,3:3>>),
  206:      ?T(<<I_big1:60>>, <<175,158,80,88,166,48,9,3:4>>),
  207:      ?T(<<I_big1:61>>, <<87,207,40,44,83,24,4,19:5>>),
  208:      ?T(<<I_big1:62>>, <<171,231,148,22,41,140,2,19:6>>),
  209:      ?T(<<I_big1:63>>, <<85,243,202,11,20,198,1,19:7>>),
  210: 
  211:      %% Test non-byte sizes and also that the value does not bleed
  212:      %% into the previous segment.
  213:      ?T(<<17, I_big1:33>>, <<17, 197,49,128,73,1:1>>),
  214:      ?T(<<19, I_big1:39>>, <<19, 11,20,198,1,19:7>>)
  215:     ].
  216: 
  217: native_3798() ->
  218:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  219: 	<<0,1>> -> [64,66,253,112,163,215,10,61];
  220: 	<<1,0>> -> [61,10,215,163,112,253,66,64]
  221:     end.
  222: 
  223: native_bignum() ->
  224:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  225: 	<<0,1>> -> [129,205,18,177,1,213,170,101,39,231,109,128,176,11,73,217];
  226: 	<<1,0>> -> [217,73,11,176,128,109,231,39,101,170,213,1,177,18,205,129]
  227:     end.
  228: 
  229: native_utf16() ->
  230:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  231: 	<<0,1>> -> [4,77,4,66,4,62,0,32,4,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58];
  232:         <<1,0>> -> [77,4,66,4,62,4,32,0,65,4,63,4,67,4,66,4,61,4,56,4,58,4]
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: native_utf32() ->
  236:     case <<1:16/native>> of
  237: 	<<0,1>> -> [0,0,4,50,0,0,4,62,0,0,4,52,0,0,4,48];
  238:         <<1,0>> -> [50,4,0,0,62,4,0,0,52,4,0,0,48,4,0,0]
  239:     end.
  240: 
  241: evaluate(Str, Vars) ->
  242:     {ok,Tokens,_} =
  243: 	erl_scan:string(Str ++ " . "),
  244:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  245:     case erl_eval:expr(Expr, Vars) of
  246: 	{value, Result, _} ->
  247: 	    Result
  248:     end.
  249: 
  250: eval_list([], _Vars) ->
  251:     [];
  252: eval_list([{C_bin, Str, Bytes} | Rest], Vars) ->
  253:     case catch evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  254: 	{'EXIT', Error} ->
  255: 	    io:format("Evaluation error: ~p, ~p, ~p~n", [Str, Vars, Error]),
  256: 	    exit(Error);
  257: 	E_bin ->
  258: 	    [{C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes} | eval_list(Rest, Vars)]
  259:     end.
  260: 
  261: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes}) when is_list(Bytes) ->
  262:     io:format("  ~ts, ~p~n", [Str, Bytes]),
  263:     Bin = list_to_binary(Bytes),
  264:     if
  265: 	C_bin == Bin ->
  266: 	    ok;
  267: 	true ->
  268: 	    io:format("ERROR: Compiled: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  269: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(C_bin)]),
  270: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  271:     end,
  272:     if
  273: 	E_bin == Bin ->
  274: 	    ok;
  275: 	true ->
  276: 	    io:format("ERROR: Interpreted: ~p.~nExpected ~p.~nGot ~p.~n",
  277: 		      [Str, Bytes, binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  278: 	    ct:fail(comp)
  279:     end;
  280: one_test({C_bin, E_bin, Str, Result}) ->
  281:     io:format("  ~ts ~p~n", [Str, C_bin]),
  282:     if
  283: 	C_bin == E_bin ->
  284: 	    ok;
  285: 	true ->
  286: 	    Arbitrary = case Result of
  287: 			    unknown ->
  288: 				size(C_bin);
  289: 			    _ ->
  290: 				Result
  291: 			end,
  292: 	    case equal_lists(binary_to_list(C_bin),
  293: 			     binary_to_list(E_bin),
  294: 			     Arbitrary) of
  295: 		false ->
  296: 		    io:format("ERROR: Compiled not equal to interpreted:"
  297: 			      "~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  298: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  299: 		    ct:fail(comp);
  300: 		0 ->
  301: 		    ok;
  302: 		%% For situations where the final bits may not matter, like
  303: 		%% for floats:
  304: 		N when is_integer(N) ->
  305: 		    io:format("Info: compiled and interpreted differ in the"
  306: 			      " last bytes:~n ~p, ~p.~n",
  307: 			      [binary_to_list(C_bin), binary_to_list(E_bin)]),
  308: 		    ok
  309: 	    end
  310:     end.
  311: 
  312: equal_lists([], [], _) ->
  313:     0;
  314: equal_lists([], _, _) ->
  315:     false;
  316: equal_lists(_, [], _) ->
  317:     false;
  318: equal_lists([A|AR], [A|BR], R) ->
  319:     equal_lists(AR, BR, R);
  320: equal_lists(A, B, R) ->
  321:     if
  322: 	length(A) /= length(B) ->
  323: 	    false;
  324: 	length(A) =< R ->
  325: 	    R;
  326: 	true ->
  327: 	    false
  328:     end.
  329: 
  330: fail_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}, Str, Vars) ->
  331:     try	evaluate(Str, Vars) of
  332: 	Res ->
  333: 	    io:format("Interpreted result: ~p", [Res]),
  334: 	    ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_intepreted_code)
  335:     catch
  336: 	error:badarg ->
  337: 	    ok
  338:     end;
  339: fail_check(Res, _, _) ->
  340:     io:format("Compiled result: ~p", [Res]),
  341:     ct:fail(did_not_fail_in_compiled_code).
  342: 
  343: %%% Simple working cases
  344: test1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  345:     I_13 = id(13),
  346:     I_big1 = id(57285702734876389752897683),
  347:     Vars = [{'I_13', I_13},
  348:             {'I_big1', I_big1}],
  349:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(l(I_13, I_big1), Vars)).
  350: 
  351: %%% Misc
  352: 
  353: %%% <<A:S, A:(N-S)>>
  354: comp(N, A, S) ->
  355:     M1 = (1 bsl S) - 1,
  356:     M2 = (1 bsl (N-S)) - 1,
  357:     [((A band M1) bsl (N-S)) bor (A band M2)].
  358: 
  359: gen(N, S, A) ->
  360:     [?T(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  361: 
  362: gen_l(N, S, A) ->
  363:     [?T(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>, comp(N, A, S))].
  364: 
  365: test2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  366:     test2(0, 8, 2#10101010101010101),
  367:     test2(0, 8, 2#1111111111).
  368: 
  369: test2(End, End, _) ->
  370:     ok;
  371: test2(I, End, A) ->
  372:     test2(I, A),
  373:     test2(I+1, End, A).
  374: 
  375: test2(S, A) ->
  376:     N = 8,
  377:     Vars = [{'A',A}, {'N',N}, {'S',S}],
  378:     io:format("Vars: ~p\n", [Vars]),
  379:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen(N, S, A), Vars)),
  380:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  381: 
  382: %%% Tests without facit
  383: 
  384: t3() ->
  385:     [?N(<<4711:13, 9876:13, 3:6>>),
  386:      ?N(<<4.57:64/float>>),
  387:      ?N(<<4.57:32/float>>),
  388: 
  389:      ?N(<<>>)
  390:     ].
  391: 
  392: test3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     Vars = [],
  394:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(t3(), Vars)).
  395: 
  396: gen_u(N, S, A) ->
  397:     [?N(<<A:S, A:(N-S)>>)].
  398: 
  399: gen_u_l(N, S, A) ->
  400:     [?N(<<A:S/little, A:(N-S)/little>>)].
  401: 
  402: test4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  403:     test4(0, 16, 2#10101010101010101),
  404:     test4(0, 16, 2#1111111111).
  405: 
  406: test4(End, End, _) ->
  407:     ok;
  408: test4(I, End, A) ->
  409:     test4(I, A),
  410:     test4(I+1, End, A).
  411: 
  412: test4(S, A) ->
  413:     N = 16,
  414:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 16}, {'S', S}],
  415:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u(N, S, A), Vars)),
  416:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_u_l(N, S, A), Vars)).
  417: 
  418: gen_b(N, S, A) ->
  419:     [?T(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>,
  420: 	binary_to_list(<<A:S/binary-unit:1, A:(N-S)/binary-unit:1>>))].
  421: 
  422: %% OTP-3995
  423: test5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  424:     test5(0, 8, <<73>>),
  425:     test5(0, 8, <<68>>).
  426: 
  427: test5(End, End, _) ->
  428:     ok;
  429: test5(I, End, A) ->
  430:     test5(I, A),
  431:     test5(I+1, End, A).
  432: 
  433: test5(S, A) ->
  434:     N = 8,
  435:     Vars = [{'A', A}, {'N', 8}, {'S', S}],
  436:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(gen_b(N, S, A), Vars)).
  437: 
  438: %%% Failure cases
  439: testf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  440:     ?FAIL(<<3.14>>),
  441:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2>>>>),
  442: 
  443:     ?FAIL(<<2.71/binary>>),
  444:     ?FAIL(<<24334/binary>>),
  445:     ?FAIL(<<24334344294788947129487129487219847/binary>>),
  446:     BigInt = id(24334344294788947129487129487219847),
  447:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  448:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42,BigInt/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  449:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<BigInt:2/binary>>, [{'BigInt',BigInt}]),
  450: 
  451:     %% One negative field size, but the sum of field sizes will be 1 byte.
  452:     %% Make sure that we reject that properly.
  453:     I_minus_777 = id(-777),
  454:     I_minus_2047 = id(-2047),
  455:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<I_minus_777:2048/unit:8,57:I_minus_2047/unit:8>>,
  456: 		     ordsets:from_list([{'I_minus_777',I_minus_777},
  457: 					{'I_minus_2047',I_minus_2047}])),
  458:     ?FAIL(<<<<1,2,3>>/float>>),
  459: 
  460:     %% Negative field widths.
  461:     testf_1(-8, <<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  462:     ?FAIL(<<0:(-(1 bsl 100))>>),
  463: 
  464:     ?FAIL(<<42:(-16)>>),
  465:     ?FAIL(<<3.14:(-8)/float>>),
  466:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(-16)/binary>>),
  467:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(2.5)/binary>>),
  468:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  469:     ?FAIL(<<<<23,56,0,2>>:(anka)>>),
  470: 
  471:     %% Unit failures.
  472:     ?FAIL(<<<<1:1>>/binary>>),
  473:     Sz = id(1),
  474:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<<<1:Sz>>/binary>>, [{'Sz',Sz}]),
  475:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<<<1:(id(1))>>/binary>>),
  476:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  477:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:16>>),
  478:     ?FAIL(<<<<7,8,9,3:7>>/binary-unit:17>>),
  479: 
  480:     %% Failures not deteced by v3_core. Those must be detected at
  481:     %% runtime.
  482:     Atom = id(ok),
  483:     Float = id(2.71),
  484:     List = id([-1,0,1]),
  485:     NonBinaries = [{'Atom',Atom}, {'Float',Float}, {'List',List}],
  486:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Atom/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  487:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Atom/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  488:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<0,Atom/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  489:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Float/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  490:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<Float/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  491:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<List/bits>>, NonBinaries),
  492:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<List/bits,0>>, NonBinaries),
  493: 
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: testf_1(W, B) ->
  497:     Vars = [{'W',W}],
  498:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<42:W>>, Vars),
  499:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<3.14:W/float>>, Vars),
  500:     ?FAIL_VARS(<<B:W/binary>>, [{'B',B}|Vars]).
  501: 
  502: %% Test that constructed binaries that are not used will still give an exception.
  503: not_used(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     ok = not_used1(3, <<"dum">>),
  505:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used1(3, "dum")),
  506:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, -2)),
  507:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used2(444, anka)),
  508:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not_used3(444)),
  509:     ok.
  510: 
  511: not_used1(I, BinString) ->
  512:     <<I:32,BinString/binary>>,
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: not_used2(I, Sz) ->
  516:     <<I:Sz>>,
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: not_used3(I) ->
  520:     <<I:(-8)>>,
  521:     ok.
  522: 
  523: in_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  524:     1 = in_guard(<<16#74ad:16>>, 16#e95, 5),
  525:     2 = in_guard(<<16#3A,16#F7,"hello">>, 16#3AF7, <<"hello">>),
  526:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3.1415/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3.1415),
  527:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,3/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 3),
  528:     3 = in_guard(<<16#FBCD:14,(2 bsl 226)/float,3:2>>, 16#FBCD, 2 bsl 226),
  529:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, 42, b),
  530:     nope = in_guard(<<1>>, a, b),
  531:     nope = in_guard(<<1,2>>, 1, 1),
  532:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, 2.71),
  533:     nope = in_guard(<<4,5>>, 1, <<12,13>>),
  534:     ok.
  535: 
  536: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:13,B:3>> == Bin -> 1;
  537: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:16,B/binary>> == Bin -> 2;
  538: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when <<A:14,B/float,3:2>> == Bin -> 3;
  539: in_guard(Bin, A, B) when {a,b,<<A:14,B/float,3:2>>} == Bin -> cant_happen;
  540: in_guard(_, _, _) -> nope.
  541: 
  542: %% Make sure that construction has no memory leak
  543: mem_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  544:     B = make_bin(16, <<0>>),
  545:     mem_leak(1024, B),
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: mem_leak(0, _) -> ok;
  549: mem_leak(N, B) ->
  550:     big_bin(B, <<23>>),
  551:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch big_bin(B, bad)),
  552:     mem_leak(N-1, B).
  553: 
  554: big_bin(B1, B2) ->
  555:     <<B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  556:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  557:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  558:       B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,B1/binary,
  559:       B2/binary>>.
  560:     
  561: make_bin(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  562: make_bin(N, Acc) -> make_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary,Acc/binary>>).
  563: 
  564: -define(COF(Int0),
  565: 	(fun(Int) ->
  566: 		 true = <<Int:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):16/float>>,
  567: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  568: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  569: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  570: 	true = <<Int0:16/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):16/float>>,
  571: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  572: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  573: 
  574: -define(COF32(Int0),
  575: 	(fun(Int) ->
  576: 		 true = <<Int:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):32/float>>,
  577: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  578: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  579: 	true = <<Int0:32/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):32/float>>,
  580: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  581: 
  582: -define(COF64(Int0),
  583: 	(fun(Int) ->
  584: 		 true = <<Int:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int)):64/float>>
  585: 	 end)(nonliteral(Int0)),
  586: 	true = <<Int0:64/float>> =:= <<(float(Int0)):64/float>>).
  587: 
  588: nonliteral(X) -> X.
  589:     
  590: coerce_to_float(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  591:     ?COF(0),
  592:     ?COF(-1),
  593:     ?COF(1),
  594:     ?COF(42),
  595:     ?COF(255),
  596:     ?COF(-255),
  597:     ?COF(38474),
  598:     ?COF(65504),
  599:     ?COF(-65504),
  600:     ?COF32(387498738948729893849444444443),
  601:     ?COF32(-37489378937773899999999999999993),
  602:     ?COF64(298748888888888888888888888883478264866528467367364766666666666666663),
  603:     ?COF64(-367546729879999999999947826486652846736736476555566666663),
  604:     ok.
  605: 
  606: bjorn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  607:     error = bjorn_1(),
  608:     ok.
  609: 
  610: bjorn_1() ->
  611:     Bitstr = <<7:13>>,
  612:     try
  613: 	do_something()
  614:     catch
  615: 	throw:blurf ->
  616: 	    ignore
  617:     end,
  618:     do_more(Bitstr, 13).
  619: 
  620: do_more(Bin, Sz) ->
  621:     %% Previous bug in the bs_bits_to_bytes instruction: The exeption code
  622:     %% was not set - the previous exception (throw:blurf) would be used,
  623:     %% causing the catch to slip.
  624:     try <<Bin:Sz/binary>> of
  625: 	_V -> ok
  626:     catch
  627: 	error:_ ->
  628: 	    error
  629:     end.
  630: 
  631: do_something() ->
  632:     throw(blurf).
  633: 
  634: append_empty_is_same(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  635:     NonWritableBin = <<"123">>,
  636:     true = erts_debug:same(NonWritableBin, append(NonWritableBin, <<>>)),
  637:     WritableBin = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  638:     true = erts_debug:same(WritableBin, append(WritableBin, <<>>)),
  639:     ok.
  640: 
  641: append(A, B) ->
  642:     <<A/binary, B/binary>>.
  643: 
  644: huge_float_field(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0.0:9/float-unit:8>>),
  646:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:67108865/float-unit:64>>),
  647:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  648:     huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:(id(67108865))/float-unit:64>>),
  649: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<0.0:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  650:     huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 26)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  651: %%  huge_float_check(catch <<3839739387439387383739387987347983:((1 bsl 60)+1)/float-unit:64>>),
  652:     ok.
  653: 
  654: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{system_limit,_}}) -> ok;
  655: huge_float_check({'EXIT',{badarg,_}}) -> ok.
  656: 
  657: system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  658:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  659:     BitsPerWord = WordSize * 8,
  660:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  661: 	(catch <<0:(id(0)),42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord))>>),
  662:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  663: 	(catch <<42:(id(1 bsl BitsPerWord)),0:(id(0))>>),
  664:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} =
  665: 	(catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(1 bsl 100))>>),
  666: 
  667:     %% Would fail to load.
  668:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 67)>>),
  669:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 64)+1)>>),
  670: 
  671:     case WordSize of
  672: 	4 ->
  673: 	    system_limit_32();
  674: 	8 ->
  675: 	    ok
  676:     end.
  677: 
  678: system_limit_32() ->
  679:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(-1)>>),
  680:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-1))>>),
  681:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(-389739873536870912))/unit:8>>),
  682:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  683:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  684:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:536870912/unit:8>>),
  685:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(8)),42:(id(536870912))/unit:8>>),
  686: 
  687:     %% The size would be silently truncated, resulting in a crash.
  688:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 35)>>),
  689:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 32)+1)>>),
  690: 
  691:     %% Would fail to load.
  692:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:(1 bsl 43)>>),
  693:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch <<0:((1 bsl 40)+1)>>),
  694:     ok.
  695: 
  696: badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  697:     <<3:2>> = <<1:(id(1)),1:(id(1))>>,
  698:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-1))>>),
  699:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(1)),0:(id(-(1 bsl 70)))>>),
  700:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<0:(id(-(1 bsl 70))),0:(id(1))>>),
  701:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0:(id(-(1)))>>),
  702:     ok.
  703: 
  704: copy_writable_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  705:     [copy_writable_binary_1(I) || I <- lists:seq(0, 256)],
  706:     ok.
  707: 
  708: copy_writable_binary_1(_) ->
  709:     Bin0 = <<(id(<<>>))/binary,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7>>,
  710:     SubBin = make_sub_bin(Bin0),
  711:     id(<<42,34,55,Bin0/binary>>),		%Make reallocation likelier.
  712:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  713: 			      copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin0, SubBin)
  714: 		      end),
  715:     Tab = ets:new(holder, []),
  716:     ets:insert(Tab, {17,Bin0}),
  717:     ets:insert(Tab, {42,SubBin}),
  718:     id(<<Bin0/binary,0:(64*1024*8)>>),
  719:     Pid ! self(),
  720:     [{17,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 17),
  721:     [{42,Bin0}] = ets:lookup(Tab, 42),
  722:     receive
  723: 	{Pid,Bin0,Bin0} -> ok;
  724: 	Other ->
  725: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected message: ~p", [Other])
  726:     end,
  727:     ok.
  728: 
  729: copy_writable_binary_holder(Bin, SubBin) ->
  730:     receive
  731: 	Pid ->
  732: 	    Pid ! {self(),Bin,SubBin}
  733:     end.
  734: 
  735: make_sub_bin(Bin0) ->
  736:     N = bit_size(Bin0),
  737:     <<_:17,Bin:N/bitstring,_:5>> = <<(-1):17,Bin0/bitstring,(-1):5>>,
  738:     Bin = Bin0,					%Assertion.
  739:     Bin.
  740: 
  741: %% Make sure that bit syntax expression with huge field size are
  742: %% not constructed at compile time.
  743: 
  744: kostis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  745:     case have_250_terabytes_of_ram() of
  746: 	true ->
  747: 	    Bin = <<0:800000000000>>,
  748: 	    EmbeddedBin = <<0,(<<0:99999999999>>)/bitstring,1>>,
  749: 	    Bin0 = list_to_binary([Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin,Bin]),
  750: 	    Bin1 = list_to_binary([Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0,Bin0]),
  751: 	    Bin2 = list_to_binary([Bin1,Bin1]),
  752: 	    id({EmbeddedBin,Bin0,Bin1,Bin2});
  753: 	false ->
  754: 	    ok
  755:     end.
  756: 
  757: %% I'm not even certain how much 250 TB really is...
  758: %% but I'm sure I don't have it :-)
  759: 
  760: have_250_terabytes_of_ram() -> false.
  761: 
  762: %% Test that different ways of using bit syntax instructions
  763: %% give the same result.
  764: 
  765: dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  766:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_big/5),
  767:     dynamic_1(fun dynamic_little/5),
  768:     ok.
  769: 		      
  770: dynamic_1(Dynamic) ->
  771:     <<Lpad:128>> = erlang:md5([0]),
  772:     <<Rpad:128>> = erlang:md5([1]),
  773:     <<Int:128>> = erlang:md5([2]),
  774:     8385 = dynamic_2(0, {Int,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}, 0).
  775: 
  776: dynamic_2(129, _, Count) -> Count;
  777: dynamic_2(Bef, Data, Count0) ->
  778:     Count = dynamic_3(Bef, 128-Bef, Data, Count0),
  779:     dynamic_2(Bef+1, Data, Count).
  780: 
  781: dynamic_3(_, -1, _, Count) -> Count;
  782: dynamic_3(Bef, N, {Int0,Lpad,Rpad,Dynamic}=Data, Count) ->
  783:     Int1 = Int0 band ((1 bsl (N+3))-1),
  784:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  785:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int1, Lpad, Rpad),
  786: 
  787:     %% OTP-7085: Test a small number in a wide segment.
  788:     Int2 = Int0 band 16#FFFFFF,
  789:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  790:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int2, Lpad, Rpad),
  791: 
  792:     %% Test a bignum in a short segment.
  793:     Int4 = ((Lpad bxor Rpad) bsl N) bor Int0,
  794:     Dynamic(Bef, N, Int4, Lpad, Rpad),
  795:     Dynamic(Bef, N, -Int4, Lpad, Rpad),
  796: 
  797:     dynamic_3(Bef, N-1, Data, Count+1).
  798: 
  799: dynamic_big(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  800:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N>>),
  801:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  802:     <<MaskedInt:N>> = NumBin,
  803: 
  804:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  805:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>),
  806:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>,
  807: 
  808:     %% Units are seldom used with integer segments even in our test
  809:     %% suites, and I have never seen non-power-of-two units in
  810:     %% production code.
  811:     if
  812:         Bef rem 8 =:= 0 ->
  813:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 8)/unit:8,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>;
  814:         Bef rem 7 =:= 0 ->
  815:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 7)/unit:7,Int:N,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)>>;
  816:         (128-Bef-N) rem 5 =:= 0 ->
  817:             Aft = (128 - Bef - N) div 5,
  818:             Bin = <<Lpad:Bef,Int:N,Rpad:Aft/unit:5>>;
  819:         true ->
  820:             ok
  821:     end,
  822: 
  823:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  824:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  825:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  826:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  827:     <<LpadMasked:Bef,MaskedInt:N,RpadMasked:Rbits>> = id(Bin),
  828:     ok.
  829: 
  830: dynamic_little(Bef, N, Int, Lpad, Rpad) ->
  831:     NumBin = id(<<Int:N/little>>),
  832:     MaskedInt = Int band ((1 bsl N) - 1),
  833:     <<MaskedInt:N/little>> = NumBin,
  834: 
  835:     %% Construct the binary in two different ways.
  836:     Bin = id(<<Lpad:Bef/little,NumBin/bitstring,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>),
  837:     Bin = <<Lpad:Bef/little,Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>,
  838: 
  839:     if
  840:         Bef rem 8 =:= 0 ->
  841:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 8)/little-unit:8,
  842:                     Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>;
  843:         Bef rem 9 =:= 0 ->
  844:             Bin = <<Lpad:(Bef div 9)/little-unit:9,
  845:                     Int:N/little,Rpad:(128-Bef-N)/little>>;
  846:         (128-Bef-N) rem 17 =:= 0 ->
  847:             Aft = (128 - Bef - N) div 17,
  848:             Bin = <<Lpad:Bef/little,Int:N/little,Rpad:Aft/little-unit:17>>;
  849:         true ->
  850:             ok
  851:     end,
  852: 
  853:     %% Further verify the result by matching.
  854:     LpadMasked = Lpad band ((1 bsl Bef) - 1),
  855:     RpadMasked = Rpad band ((1 bsl (128-Bef-N)) - 1),
  856:     Rbits = (128-Bef-N),
  857:     <<LpadMasked:Bef/little,MaskedInt:N/little,RpadMasked:Rbits/little>> = id(Bin),
  858:     ok.
  859: 
  860: %% Test that the bs_add/5 instruction handles big numbers correctly.
  861: bs_add(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  862:     Mod = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_" ++
  863:                            atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
  864:     N = 2000,
  865:     Code = [{module, Mod},
  866: 	    {exports, [{bs_add,2}]},
  867: 	    {labels, 2},
  868: 
  869: 	    %% bs_add(Number, -SmallestBig) -> Number + N
  870: 	    {function, bs_add, 2, 2},
  871: 	    {label,1},
  872: 	    {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,bs_add},2},
  873: 
  874: 	    {label,2},
  875: 	    {move,{x,0},{x,2}}] ++
  876: 	lists:duplicate(N-1, {bs_add,{f,0},[{x,2},{integer,1},1],{x,2}}) ++
  877: 	[{gc_bif,abs,{f,0},3,[{x,1}],{x,4}},	%Force GC, ignore result.
  878: 	 {gc_bif,'+',{f,0},3,[{x,2},{integer,1}],{x,0}}, %Safe result in {x,0}
  879: 	 return],
  880: 
  881:     %% Write assembly file and assemble it.
  882:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  883:     RootName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  884:     AsmFile = RootName ++ ".S",
  885:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write]),
  886:     [io:format(Fd, "~p. \n", [T]) || T <- Code],
  887:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  888:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,report,{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  889:     LoadRc = code:load_abs(RootName),
  890:     {module,_Module} = LoadRc,
  891: 
  892:     %% Find smallest positive bignum.
  893:     SmallestBig = smallest_big(),
  894:     io:format("~p\n", [SmallestBig]),
  895:     DoTest = fun() ->
  896: 		     exit(Mod:bs_add(SmallestBig, -SmallestBig))
  897: 	     end,
  898:     {Pid,Mref} = spawn_monitor(DoTest),
  899:     receive
  900: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Pid,Res} -> ok
  901:     end,
  902: 
  903:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  904:         8 ->
  905:             %% bignum-sized binaries must system_limit on 64-bit platforms
  906:             {system_limit, _} = Res;
  907:         4 ->
  908:             Res = SmallestBig + N
  909:     end,
  910: 
  911:     %% Clean up.
  912:     ok = file:delete(AsmFile),
  913:     ok = file:delete(code:which(Mod)),
  914:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  915:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  916: 
  917:     ok.
  918: 
  919: 
  920: smallest_big() ->
  921:     smallest_big_1(1 bsl 24).
  922: 
  923: smallest_big_1(N) ->
  924:     case erts_debug:flat_size(N) of
  925: 	0 -> smallest_big_1(N+N);
  926: 	_  -> N
  927:     end.
  928: 
  929: otp_7422(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  930:     otp_7422_int(0),
  931:     otp_7422_bin(0).
  932: 
  933: otp_7422_int(N) when N < 512 ->
  934:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  935:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  936: 		       id(T),
  937: 		       %% A size of field 0 would write one byte beyond
  938: 		       %% the current position in the binary. It could
  939: 		       %% overwrite the continuation pointer stored on
  940: 		       %% the stack if HTOP was equal to E (the stack pointer).
  941: 		       id(<<0:(id(0))>>)
  942: 	       end),
  943:     otp_7422_int(N+1);
  944: otp_7422_int(_) -> ok.
  945: 
  946: otp_7422_bin(N) when N < 512 ->
  947:     T = erlang:make_tuple(N, []),
  948:     Z = id(<<>>),
  949:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  950: 		       id(T),
  951: 		       id(<<Z:(id(0))/bits>>)
  952: 	       end),
  953:     otp_7422_bin(N+1);
  954: otp_7422_bin(_) -> ok.
  955: 
  956: zero_width(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  957:     Z = id(0),
  958:     Small = id(42),
  959:     Big = id(1 bsl 128),
  960:     <<>> = <<Small:Z>>,
  961:     <<>> = <<Small:0>>,
  962:     <<>> = <<Big:Z>>,
  963:     <<>> = <<Big:0>>,
  964:     
  965:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<not_a_number:0>>),
  966:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):Z>>),
  967:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch <<(id(not_a_number)):0>>),
  968: 
  969:     ok.
  970: 
  971: bad_append(_) ->
  972:     do_bad_append(<<127:1>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  973:     do_bad_append(<<127:2>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  974:     do_bad_append(<<127:17>>, fun append_unit_3/1),
  975: 
  976:     do_bad_append(<<127:3>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  977:     do_bad_append(<<127:5>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  978:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  979:     do_bad_append(<<127:199>>, fun append_unit_4/1),
  980: 
  981:     do_bad_append(<<127:7>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  982:     do_bad_append(<<127:9>>, fun append_unit_8/1),
  983: 
  984:     do_bad_append(<<0:8>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  985:     do_bad_append(<<0:15>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  986:     do_bad_append(<<0:17>>, fun append_unit_16/1),
  987:     ok.
  988: 
  989: do_bad_append(Bin0, Appender) ->
  990:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin0)),
  991: 
  992:     Bin1 = id(<<0:3,Bin0/bitstring>>),
  993:     <<_:3,Bin2/bitstring>> = Bin1,
  994:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin2)),
  995: 
  996:     %% Create a writable binary.
  997:     Empty = id(<<>>),
  998:     Bin3 = <<Empty/bitstring,Bin0/bitstring>>,
  999:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Appender(Bin3)),
 1000:     ok.
 1001: 
 1002: append_unit_3(Bin) ->
 1003:     <<Bin/binary-unit:3,0:1>>.
 1004: 
 1005: append_unit_4(Bin) ->
 1006:     <<Bin/binary-unit:4,0:1>>.
 1007: 
 1008: append_unit_8(Bin) ->
 1009:     <<Bin/binary,0:1>>.
 1010: 
 1011: append_unit_16(Bin) ->
 1012:     <<Bin/binary-unit:16,0:1>>.
 1013: 
 1014: %% Test that the bs_append instruction will correctly check for
 1015: %% overflow by producing a binary whose total size would exceed the
 1016: %% maximum allowed size for a binary on a 32-bit computer.
 1017: 
 1018: bs_append_overflow(_Config) ->
 1019:     Memsize = memsize(),
 1020:     io:format("Memsize = ~w Bytes~n", [Memsize]),
 1021:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1022: 	8 ->
 1023:             %% Not possible to test on a 64-bit computer.
 1024: 	    {skip, "64-bit architecture"};
 1025:         _ when Memsize < (2 bsl 30) ->
 1026: 	    {skip, "Less than 2 GB of memory"};
 1027: 	4 ->
 1028:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_signed()),
 1029:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1030:             {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} = (catch bs_append_overflow_unsigned()),
 1031:             erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1032: 	    ok
 1033:     end.
 1034: 
 1035: bs_append_overflow_signed() ->
 1036:     %% Produce a large binary that, if cast to signed int, would
 1037:     %% overflow into a negative number that fits a smallnum.
 1038:     Large = <<0:((1 bsl 30)-1)>>,
 1039:     <<Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
 1040:       Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits, Large/bits,
 1041:       Large/bits>>.
 1042: 
 1043: bs_append_overflow_unsigned() ->
 1044:     %% The following would succeed but would produce an incorrect result
 1045:     %% where B =:= C!
 1046:     A = <<0:((1 bsl 32)-8)>>,
 1047:     B = <<2, 3>>,
 1048:     C = <<A/binary,1,B/binary>>,
 1049:     true = byte_size(B) < byte_size(C).
 1050: 
 1051: bs_append_offheap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1052:     %% test that erts_bs_private_append is reflected correctly in
 1053:     %%  process_info(Pid, binary()) report for off-heap binaries.
 1054:     {Pid, MRef} = erlang:spawn_monitor(fun bs_append_offheap_proc/0),
 1055:     receive
 1056:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} ->
 1057:             ok;
 1058:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {{badmatch,[{binary,[]}]}, _}} ->
 1059:             {fail, "missing binary in erts_bs_private_append"}
 1060:     end.
 1061: 
 1062: bs_append_offheap_proc() ->
 1063:     Self = self(),
 1064:     Len = 128,
 1065:     OffHeapBin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Len, $b)),
 1066:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
 1067:     [{binary, [{_, Len, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
 1068:     Bin = <<OffHeapBin/binary, "a">>,
 1069:     erlang:garbage_collect(Self),
 1070:     %% expect a single binary (2 bytes longer than the original)
 1071:     [{binary, [{_, _, 1}]}] = erlang:process_info(Self, [binary]),
 1072:     Bin.
 1073: 
 1074: reductions(_Config) ->
 1075:     TwoMeg = <<0:(2_000*1024)/unit:8>>,
 1076:     reds_at_least(2000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
 1077:     reds_at_least(4000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg/binary>> end),
 1078:     reds_at_least(1000, fun() -> <<0:8,TwoMeg:(1000*1024)/binary>> end),
 1079: 
 1080:     %% Here we expect about 500 reductions in the bs_append
 1081:     %% instruction for setting up a writable binary and about 2000
 1082:     %% reductions in the bs_put_binary instruction for copying the
 1083:     %% binary data.
 1084:     reds_at_least(2500, fun() -> <<TwoMeg/binary,TwoMeg:(2000*1024)/binary>> end),
 1085:     ok.
 1086: 
 1087: reds_at_least(N, Fun) ->
 1088:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1089:     {reductions,Red0} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1090:     _ = Fun(),
 1091:     {reductions,Red1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1092:     Diff = Red1 - Red0,
 1093:     io:format("Expected at least ~p; got ~p\n", [N,Diff]),
 1094:     if
 1095:         Diff >= N ->
 1096:             ok;
 1097:         Diff ->
 1098:             ct:fail({expected,N,got,Diff})
 1099:     end.
 1100: memsize() ->
 1101:     application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
 1102:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1103:         undefined ->
 1104:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1105:             Tot;
 1106:         Available ->
 1107:             Available
 1108:     end.
 1109: 
 1110: -define(FP16(EncodedInt, Float),
 1111:         (fun(NlInt, NlFloat) ->
 1112:                  {0, true} = {0, <<NlInt:16>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float>>},
 1113:                  {1, true} = {1, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float>>},
 1114:                  {2, true} = {2, <<NlInt:16/little>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
 1115:                  {3, true} = {3, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-little>>},
 1116:                  {4, true} = {4, <<NlInt:16/native>> =:= <<NlFloat:16/float-native>>},
 1117:                  {5, true} = {5, <<(NlInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-NlFloat:16/float-native>>}
 1118:          end)(nonliteral(EncodedInt), nonliteral(Float)),
 1119:         {a, true} = {a, <<EncodedInt:16>> =:= <<Float:16/float>>},
 1120:         {b, true} = {b, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16>> =:= <<-Float:16/float>>},
 1121:         {c, true} = {c, <<EncodedInt:16/little>> =:= <<Float:16/float-little>>},
 1122:         {d, true} = {d, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/little>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-little>>},
 1123:         {e, true} = {e, <<EncodedInt:16/native>> =:= <<Float:16/float-native>>},
 1124:         {f, true} = {f, <<(EncodedInt+16#8000):16/native>> =:= <<-Float:16/float-native>>}).
 1125: 
 1126: fp16(_Config) ->
 1127:     %% smallest positive subnormal number
 1128:     ?FP16(16#0001, 0.000000059604645),
 1129:     %% largest positive subnormal number
 1130:     ?FP16(16#03ff, 0.000060975552),
 1131:     %% smallest positive normal number
 1132:     ?FP16(16#0400, 0.00006103515625),
 1133:     %% largest normal number
 1134:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504),
 1135:     ?FP16(16#7bff, 65504.0),
 1136:     %% largest number less than one
 1137:     ?FP16(16#3bff, 0.99951172),
 1138:     %% zero
 1139:     ?FP16(16#0000, 0.0),
 1140:     %% one
 1141:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1),
 1142:     ?FP16(16#3c00, 1.0),
 1143:     %% smallest number larger than one
 1144:     ?FP16(16#3c01, 1.00097656),
 1145:     %% rounding of 1/3 to nearest
 1146:     ?FP16(16#3555, 0.33325195),
 1147:     %% others
 1148:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2),
 1149:     ?FP16(16#4000, 2.0),
 1150:     ok.
 1151: 
 1152: zero_init(_Config) ->
 1153:     <<LPad:64/bits,RPad:64/bits>> = id(erlang:md5([42])),
 1154:     Sizes = [511,512,513, 767,768,769, 1023,1024,1025,
 1155:              16#7fff,16#ffff,16#10000] ++ lists:seq(0, 257),
 1156:     _ = [do_zero_init(Size, LPad, RPad) || Size <- Sizes],
 1157:     ok.
 1158: 
 1159: do_zero_init(Size, LPad, RPad) ->
 1160:     try
 1161:         do_zero_init_1(Size, LPad, RPad)
 1162:     catch
 1163:         C:R:Stk ->
 1164:             io:format("Size = ~p, LPad = ~p, RPad = ~p\n", [Size, LPad, RPad]),
 1165:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1166:     end.
 1167: 
 1168: do_zero_init_1(Size, LPad, RPad) ->
 1169:     Zeroes = id(<<0:Size>>),
 1170:     <<0:Size>> = Zeroes,
 1171:     Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, Zeroes/bits, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1172:     Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1173:     Bin = id(<<LPad:(id(64))/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>),
 1174: 
 1175:     if
 1176:         Size rem 11 =:= 0 ->
 1177:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:(Size div 11)/unit:11, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1178:         true ->
 1179:             ok
 1180:     end,
 1181: 
 1182:     case Size of
 1183:         0 ->
 1184:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1185:         1 ->
 1186:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1187:         2 ->
 1188:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1189:         3 ->
 1190:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1191:         4 ->
 1192:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1193:         5 ->
 1194:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1195:         6 ->
 1196:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1197:         7 ->
 1198:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1199:         8 ->
 1200:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1201:         9 ->
 1202:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1203:         10 ->
 1204:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1205:         11 ->
 1206:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1207:         12 ->
 1208:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1209:         13 ->
 1210:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1211:         14 ->
 1212:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1213:         15 ->
 1214:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1215:         16 ->
 1216:             Bin = id(<<LPad:64/bits, 0:Size, RPad:64/bits>>);
 1217:

 1220:         32 ->

 1378: 
 1379: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr),
 1380:         fun() ->
 1381:                 try Expr of
 1382:                     _ ->
 1383:                         error(should_fail)
 1384:                 catch
 1385:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1386:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, #{})
 1387:                 end
 1388:         end()).
 1389: 
 1390: -define(ERROR_INFO(Expr, Overrides),
 1391:         fun() ->
 1392:                 try Expr of
 1393:                     _ ->
 1394:                         error(should_fail)
 1395:                 catch
 1396:                     error:Reason:Stk ->
 1397:                         error_info_verify(Reason, Stk, ??Expr, Overrides)
 1398:                 end
 1399:         end()).
 1400: 
 1401: error_info(_Config) ->
 1402:     case ?MODULE of
 1403:         bs_construct_r24_SUITE ->
 1404:             %% Error information is not implemented for old bit syntax
 1405:             %% instructions.
 1406:             ok;
 1407:         _ ->
 1408:             error_info()
 1409:     end.
 1410: 
 1411: error_info() ->
 1412:     Atom = id(some_atom),
 1413:     NegSize = id(-1),
 1414:     HugeNegSize = id(-1 bsl 64),
 1415:     Binary = id(<<"abc">>),
 1416:     HugeBig = id(1 bsl 1500),
 1417:     LongList = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1418:     BadBinary = id(ok),
 1419:     BadSize = case Atom of
 1420:                   a -> 0;
 1421:                   _ -> bad_size
 1422:               end,
 1423: 
 1424:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary, Binary/binary>>),
 1425:     {badarg, {2,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1426:     {badarg, {3,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1427:     {badarg, {4,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<1:32, "xyz", Binary/binary, Atom/binary>>),
 1428: 
 1429:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1430:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(32))>>),
 1431:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,LongList}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<LongList:32>>),
 1432:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:Atom>>),
 1433:     {badarg, {1,integer,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:32>>),
 1434:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:NegSize>>),
 1435:     {badarg, {1,integer,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:HugeNegSize>>),
 1436:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 58}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 58)/unit:255>>),
 1437:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 60}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 60)/unit:8>>),
 1438:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42:(1 bsl 64)>>),
 1439: 
 1440:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:10/binary>>),
 1441:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1442:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:Atom/binary>>),
 1443:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:NegSize/binary>>),
 1444:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:HugeNegSize/binary>>),
 1445:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,BadSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:BadSize/binary>>),
 1446:     {badarg, {1,binary,size,BadSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<BadBinary:BadSize/binary>>),
 1447:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:10/binary>>),
 1448:     {badarg, {1,binary,short,Binary}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(10))/binary>>),
 1449:     {badarg, {1,binary,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/binary>>),
 1450:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1451:     {badarg, {1,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<(id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1452:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<1:1>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<1:1>>))/binary>>),
 1453:     {badarg, {2,binary,unit,<<0:1111>>}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0, (id(<<0:1111>>))/binary>>),
 1454:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(1 bsl 64)/binary>>),
 1455:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Binary:(id(1 bsl 64))/binary>>),
 1456: 
 1457:     {badarg, {1,float,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>),
 1458:     {badarg, {1,float,size,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:Atom/float>>),
 1459:     {badarg, {1,float,size,NegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:NegSize/float>>),
 1460:     {badarg, {1,float,size,HugeNegSize}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:HugeNegSize/float>>),
 1461:     {badarg, {1,float,invalid,1}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1))/float>>),
 1462:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:(id(64))/float>>),
 1463:     {badarg, {1,float,no_float,HugeBig}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<HugeBig:64/float>>),
 1464:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,1 bsl 64}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<42.0:(id(1 bsl 64))/float>>),
 1465: 
 1466:     {badarg, {1,utf8,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf8>>),
 1467:     {badarg, {1,utf16,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf16>>),
 1468:     {badarg, {1,utf32,type,Atom}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom/utf32>>),
 1469: 
 1470:     Bin = id(<<>>),
 1471:     Float = id(42.0),
 1472:     MaxSmall = (1 bsl 59) - 1,                  %Max small for 64-bit architectures.
 1473: 
 1474:     %% Attempt constructing a binary with total size 1^64 + 32.
 1475: 
 1476:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1477:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1478:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,0:64>>),
 1479:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1480: 
 1481:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1482:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1483:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1484:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1485: 
 1486:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1487:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1488:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,0:64>>),
 1489:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:32,(id(0)):64>>),
 1490: 
 1491:     %% Test a size exceeding 1^64, where the sign bit (bit 63) is not set.
 1492:     0 = (((MaxSmall) * 33) bsr 63) band 1, %Assertion: The sign bit is not set.
 1493: 
 1494:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1495:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(MaxSmall)/unit:33>>),
 1496:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1497:     {system_limit, {1,integer,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<0:(id(MaxSmall))/unit:33>>),
 1498: 
 1499:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1500:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(MaxSmall)/binary-unit:33>>),
 1501:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1502:     {system_limit, {1,binary,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Bin:(id(MaxSmall))/binary-unit:33>>),
 1503: 
 1504:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1505:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(MaxSmall)/float-unit:33>>),
 1506:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1507:     {system_limit, {1,float,size,MaxSmall}, _} = ?ERROR_INFO(<<Float:(id(MaxSmall))/float-unit:33>>),
 1508: 
 1509:     %% error messages with options
 1510:     PP = fun(Term) -> <<"'", (erlang:atom_to_binary(Term))/binary, "'">> end,
 1511: 
 1512:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1513:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{}),
 1514: 
 1515:     {_, _, <<"segment 2 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: some_atom">>} =
 1516:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{override_segment_position => 2}),
 1517: 
 1518:     {_, _, <<"segment 1 of type 'float': expected a float or an integer but got: 'some_atom'">>} =
 1519:         ?ERROR_INFO(<<Atom:64/float>>, #{pretty_printer => PP}),
 1520: 
 1521:     ok.
 1522: 
 1523: error_info_verify(Reason, Stk0, Expr, Overrides) ->
 1524:     [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info0}|Rest] = Stk0,
 1525:     {value, {error_info, ErrorInfo}, Info1} = lists:keytake(error_info, 1, Info0),
 1526:     #{cause := Cause, module := Module, function := Function} = ErrorInfo,
 1527:     Info2 = maps:merge(ErrorInfo, Overrides),
 1528:     Stk1 = [{?MODULE, Fun, Arity, Info1 ++ [{error_info, Info2}]} | Rest],
 1529:     Result = Module:Function(Reason, Stk1),
 1530:     #{general := String} = Result,
 1531:     true = is_binary(String),
 1532:     io:format("~ts: ~ts\n", [Expr,String]),
 1533:     {Reason, Cause, String}.
 1534: 
 1535: little(_Config) ->
 1536:     _ = rand:uniform(),				%Seed generator
 1537:     io:format("Seed: ~p", [rand:export_seed()]),
 1538: 
 1539:     RandBytes = rand:bytes(10),
 1540:     _ = [do_little(RandBytes, N) || N <- lists:seq(0, 10*8)],
 1541: 
 1542:     ok.
 1543: 
 1544: do_little(Bin0, N) ->
 1545:     <<Bin1:N/bits,Bin2/bits>> = Bin0,
 1546:     Bin2Size = bit_size(Bin2),
 1547: 
 1548:     <<I1:N/little-integer>> = Bin1,
 1549:     <<I2:Bin2Size/little-integer>> = Bin2,
 1550: 
 1551:     Bin1 = <<I1:N/little-integer>>,
 1552:     Bin1 = do_little_1(N, id(I1)),
 1553: 
 1554:     Bin2 = <<I2:Bin2Size/little-integer>>,
 1555:     Bin2 = do_little_1(Bin2Size, id(I2)),
 1556: 
 1557:     ok.
 1558: 
 1559: do_little_1(0, I) -> <<I:0/little-integer>>;
 1560: do_little_1(1, I) -> <<I:1/little-integer>>;
 1561: do_little_1(2, I) -> <<I:2/little-integer>>;
 1562: do_little_1(3, I) -> <<I:3/little-integer>>;
 1563: do_little_1(4, I) -> <<I:4/little-integer>>;
 1564: do_little_1(5, I) -> <<I:5/little-integer>>;
 1565: do_little_1(6, I) -> <<I:6/little-integer>>;
 1566: do_little_1(7, I) -> <<I:7/little-integer>>;
 1567: do_little_1(8, I) -> <<I:8/little-integer>>;
 1568: do_little_1(9, I) -> <<I:9/little-integer>>;

 1573: do_little_1(14, I) -> <<I:14/little-integer>>;
 1574: do_little_1(15, I) -> <<I:15/little-integer>>;
 1575: do_little_1(16, I) -> <<I:16/little-integer>>;
 1576: do_little_1(17, I) -> <<I:17/little-integer>>;

 1689: %% GH-7469: The unit of variable-sized segments wasn't checked properly,
 1690: %% resulting in the creation of heap binaries for non-binary bitstrings.
 1691: heap_binary_unit(_Config) ->
 1692:     {ok, 14524} = heap_binary_unit_1(id(<<184,188,2,66,172,19,0,3>>)),
 1693:     ok.
 1694: 
 1695: heap_binary_unit_1(<<2:2/integer,Rest:62/bitstring>>) ->
 1696:     heap_binary_unit_2(<<2:2/integer>>, Rest).
 1697: 
 1698: heap_binary_unit_2(Variant, Rest) ->
 1699:     VariantSize = bit_size(Variant),
 1700:     ClockHiSize = 8 - VariantSize,
 1701:     ClockSize = 8 + ClockHiSize,
 1702:     case Rest of
 1703:         <<ClockHi:ClockHiSize/bitstring,
 1704:           ClockLo:8/bitstring,
 1705:           _:48/bitstring>> ->
 1706:             case
 1707:                 <<ClockHi:ClockHiSize/bitstring,
 1708:                   ClockLo:8/bitstring>>
 1709:             of
 1710:                 <<Clock:ClockSize/integer-unsigned>> ->
 1711:                     {ok, Clock};
 1712:                 Bin1 ->
 1713:                     {error1, Bin1}
 1714:             end;
 1715:         Bin2 ->
 1716:             {error2, Bin2}
 1717:     end.
 1718: 
 1719: otp_24_code_gh_8238(Config) ->
 1720:     case ?MODULE of
 1721:         bs_construct_SUITE ->
 1722:             %% GH-8238. Code compiled with Erlang/OTP 24 would crash
 1723:             %% when run on OTP-26.2.3.
 1724:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1725:             Asm = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".S"),
 1726:             {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Asm, [binary,from_asm,report]),
 1727:             {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
 1728:             Mod:Mod(),
 1729:             ok;
 1730:         _ ->
 1731:             {skip,"Enough to run once"}
 1732:     end.
 1733:
